description.narrative:
Leadership empowerment programmes with potential women leaders
Monitoring district council gender action plans for compliance and quality of services
Sessions with communities by women’s leaders
Media engagement of communities on health.
Accountability sessions with duty-bearers and communities Capacity building of Kailahun Women in Governance Network and of women councillors, political parties and traditional leaders so that they can strengthen gender equality in their wards.
Mobilisation of local stakeholders and target groups to collaborate and demand improved gender equality in governance.
Engagement of formal and informal power-holders, for example through participatory power and gender analysis and public engagement.
Women are empowered by awareness of gender acts that protection them such as Acts on domestic violence, sexual offences, Customary Marriage and Divorce, Devolution of Estates- land and inheritance.
Capacity building, engagement and advocacy of political party structures at ward, constituency and district levels for equal participation of women (for example supporting gender analysis/ assessment of these structures).

The development of gender sensitive stakeholder institutions with men and women leaders, as an entry points will drive a political change process in favour of increased women’s participation in the 2012 General Election . To realise this, gender sensitive political change process, the TOC include equipping the men and women leaders especially those in the political parties with the necessary skills and tools to act as champions for increased women’s participation in their organisations. If women’s leaders at the community level are mobilised, they will collaborate to lobby duty bearers to deliver on promises to improve on service delivery and gender action plans. If elected women can hold duty bearers to account on low representation of women in local and national decision making, then it will encourage more women to enter the political system.

mailing-address.narrative: Christian Aid, 35-41 Lower Marsh, London SE1 7RL, United Kingdom
